channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024060116
item.description:
Report E-2024060116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of acetone was damaged and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the acetone-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack. All drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024060025
item.description:
Report X-2024060025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: LORTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the truck loading process en route to the cargo's destination, it was observed that the box was leaking its contents. Promptly, the box was relocated to the Hazmat cage for thorough inspection, revealing a cracked 5-pound bucket of granular chlorine at the bottom. Notably, the package lacked any protective packaging material for the contents.

item.title: Report E-2024060216
item.description:
Report E-2024060216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer material handler noticed one of the drums on the pallet they were handling was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet had punctured the bottom of the drum. The spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum after it was repaired with drum putty.

item.title: Report X-2024060136
item.description:
Report X-2024060136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: CHESAPEAKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank car HOKX 112322 was found with dried and weathered sodium hydroxide on the exterior of the car with spillage originating around the pressure relief valve. The car was not observed leaking and it is unknown when the release occurred. The shipper, Occidental Chemical, was able to provide pictures of the car showing the car was free of product on the exterior when they released it to CSX for transportation. The car was cleaned and returned to transportation.
